title: Vehicle ban chaos: Delhi restricts non-BS VI entry; commuters, residents slam abrupt move
description: Starting Thursday, a new Delhi government regulation prohibits non-BS VI vehicles from entering the capital. This sweeping ban threatens to throw daily commutes into chaos for countless commuters from regions like Gurgaon, Noida, and Ghaziabad. With over 200,000 vehicles impacted in Gurgaon alone, tensions are rising as many express discontent regarding the swift implementation and absent alternatives.

Having entered the auction at a base price of Rs 30 lakh each, the pair went on to become the highest-paid uncapped players in IPL auction history.

description: Exciting new findings indicate that GLP-1 weight-loss medications might dramatically reduce the likelihood of 10 types of cancer linked to obesity for patients with type 2 diabetes, outperforming insulin. However, there's no observed benefit for postmenopausal breast or thyroid cancers.

description: Millions of rural Indian women are transforming their lives and communities by becoming 'Lakhpati Didis,' surpassing Rs 1 lakh in annual household income through self-help groups. This initiative, backed by government schemes, fosters financial literacy, entrepreneurship, and community influence, making these women a significant political constituency. Their economic empowerment is reshaping rural India's landscape.

With growing global barriers against China's trade surplus, the country faces an uphill battle, even as it strives to meet official growth benchmarks.

The longevity race: How far science has come in chasing immortality
description: Humanity has long been captivated by the idea of immortality, a desire to defy aging and death. While myths and literature explore this dream, science now investigates extending healthspan, not just lifespan.  Researchers are exploring cellular repair and rejuvenation, but true biological immortality remains elusive, raising profound ethical and philosophical questions about the meaning of life.

title: Bondi beach attack: Shooters inspired by IS, had military style training — what cops revealed
Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for NBA legend Stephen Curry
description: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's love story began in childhood at church, though they didn't start dating until their teenage years. Ayesha's unwavering support, even encouraging Stephen to finish his degree before the NBA draft, solidified his decision to marry her. Their enduring marriage has weathered public scrutiny, with Stephen consistently crediting his wife.

title: US visa: H-1B workers, H-4 holder to undergo social-media screening; System gets tighter
description: The US State Department has tightened visa vetting, requiring H-1B workers and their H-4 dependents to undergo social media screening. Applicants must now set all social media profiles to public for enhanced background checks, a move aimed at strengthening national security and ensuring visa eligibility.

title: Nvidia responds to DeepSeek report; denies claims of ‘banned’ chips behind January market rout
description: Nvidia has refuted claims that Chinese AI firm DeepSeek is using smuggled, restricted Blackwell chips. The report alleged DeepSeek acquired these advanced processors, banned for export to China, to train its AI models. Nvidia stated they have no evidence of such illicit activities, emphasizing their commitment to preventing circumvention of US trade restrictions.
